name: Sweet potato Starch Noodles Stir-fried with Vegetables - JapChae -
instruction:
Step 1: Put the beef and shiitake mushrooms in a bowl. Mix 1 clove minced garlic. Add 1 tsp sugar, 1/4 tsp ground black pepper, 2 tsp soysauce, and 1 tsp sesame oil. Put aside. 

Step 2: Crack the egg. Separate the yolk with the egg white. Whisk the yolk with a pinch of salt. Add 1 tsp of vegetable oil on a frying pan. Fry the yolk into a thin sheet. Let it cool and slice thinly. 

Step 3: Boil Spinach for 30 seconds, rinse with cold water and remove any excess water. Cut into eatable size and mix with 1 tsp soy sauce and 1 tsp sesame oil. 

Step 4: Cook the noodles for 8 minute. Stir often. 

Step 5: Strain the noodles and cut few times. Put them into a large bown. Add 2 tsp sesame oil, 1 tsp soy sauce, and 1 tsp sugar. Mix. 

Step 6: Stir fry sliced onions and the green onion on a frying pan with 2 tsp vegetable oil. 

Step 7: Stir fry sliced white mushrooms with a pinch of salt on the frying pan. 

Step 8: Stir fry stick sliced carrot and sliced red bell pepper on the frying pan 

Step 9: Slice beef and shiitake mushrooms. stir fry on the frying pan. 

Step 10: Put all the ingredients into a large bowl. Add 1 minced garlic clove, 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsb ground black pepper and 2 tsp sesame oil, and 1 tbsp sesame seeds. Mix well and serve.
tip: To make your meal healier, consider adding more vegetables to your plate

name: Korean Rice with Mixed Vegetables -Bibimbap-
instruction:
Step 1: Cut cucumber and carrots into matchsticks. 

Step 2: Stir cucumber pieces with 1/4 cup gochujang paste in a bowl; set aside. 

Step 3: Bring about 2 cups of water to a boil in a large nonstick skillet and stir in spinach; cook until spinach is bright green and wilted, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain spinach and squeeze out as much moisture as possible; set spinach aside in a bowl and stir soy sauce into spinach. 

Step 4: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in large nonstick skillet and cook and stir carrots until softened, about 3 minutes; stir in garlic and cook just until fragrant, about 1 more minute. Stir in cucumber pieces with gochujang paste; sprinkle with red pepper flakes, and set the mixture aside in a bowl. 

Step 5: Brown beef in a clean nonstick skillet over medium heat, about 5 minutes per side, and set aside. In a separate nonstick skillet, heat 1 more teaspoon olive oil over medium-low heat and fry the eggs just on one side until yolks are runny but whites are firm, 2 to 4 minutes each. 

Step 6: To assemble the dish, divide cooked rice into 4 large serving bowls; top with spinach mixture, a few pieces of beef, and cucumber mixture. Place 1 egg atop each serving. Drizzle each bowl with 1 teaspoon of sesame oil, a sprinkle of sesame seeds, and a small amount of gochujang paste if desired.
tip: To make your meal healier, consider adding upto 0.5 lb of vegetables like stir fried zuchini and mushrooms to your plate

name: Korean Kimchi Fried Rice
instruction:
Step 1: Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.  

Step 2: Add red onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook, stirring occasionally, until onion softens, about 3 minutes. 

Step 3: Increase heat to high and add chopped kimchi and vinegar. 

Step 4: Stir in cooked rice, soy sauce, sugar, soy sauce, kimchi brine, and sesame oil.  

Step 5: Cook and stir until heated through, about 5 minutes; scrape the bottom of the skillet to prevent sticking. 

Step 6: Season with salt and pepper.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding o.5 lb of veggies including green onion and/or carrots to your plate

name: Spicy Cabbage Kimchi
instruction:
Step 1: Cut the cabbages in half lengthwise and trim the ends. Rinse and cut into pieces about 2 inch square.  

Step 2: Place the cabbage into large resealable bags and sprinkle salt on the leaves so they are evenly coated.  

Step 3: Use your hands to rub the salt in to the leaves. Seal the bags and leave at room temperature for 6 hours. 

Step 4: Rinse the salt from the cabbage leaves and then drain and squeeze out any excess liquid.  

Step 5: Place the cabbage in a large container with a tight fitting lid. Stir in the fish sauce, green onions, white onion, garlic, sugar and ginger. Sprinkle the Korean chile powder over the mixture. Wear plastic gloves to protect your hands and rub the chile powder into the cabbage leaves until evenly coated. 

Step 6: Seal the container and set in a cool dry place. Leave undisturbed for 4 days. Refrigerate before serving, and store in the refrigerator for up to 1 month
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 1/4 of your plate with Steamed Rice and 1/4 of your plate with meat dish

name: Korean Sushi -Kimbob-
instruction:
Step 1: Cook steamed rice. 

Step 2: Cut chicken into small pieces. 

Step 3: Chop green pepper. 

Step 4: Slice mushrooms thinly. 

Step 5: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet and pan fry chicken. Add onion, mushrooms, and green pepper to the skillet and pan fry together. 

Step 6: Add steamed rice to the skillet and stir-fry together. Sprinkle salt and pepper. Stop the heat, add ketchup and mix. set the seasoned rice aside. 

Step 7: Heat 1 tp of vegetable oil in a large skillet. Beat two eggs nd pour into the skillet. Spread the egg and make a omelet. 

Step 8: Place 1/4 of the seasoned rice in the middle of the omelet. Fold top and bottom sides of omelet over the rice. Cover the frying pan with a plate and turn them over to place the omurice in the plate. 

Step 9: Repeat this process to make four omurices. 

Step 10: Serve and top with ketcup (optional)
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 1/4 lb of veggies including stir-fried carrots and/or steam spaniches to your plate

name: Korean Tofu and Vegetable Soup
instruction:
Step 1: Pour the beef stock into a stock pot or large deep skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in the toenjang until dissolved. 

Step 2: Add the kelp and garlic, and bring to a boil. Put in the tofu, cabbage, daikon and yellow squash, cover and return to a boil.  

Step 3: Cook gently for 5 minutes. Then add the green onions and hot pepper, and boil for a minute, or until the onion and pepper become fragrant and brightly colored.  

Step 4: Limit the cooking time to no more than 15 minutes. Remove and discard kelp. Serve immediately.
tip: To complete your meal, consider eating with 1/4 plate of rice

name: Korean Cucumber Salad
instruction:
Step 1: In a medium bowl, stir together vinegar, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. 

Step 2: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in sesame seeds, and reduce heat to medium. Cook until seeds are brown, about 5 minutes.  

Step 3: Remove seeds with a slotted spoon, and stir into vinegar mixture. Mix in cucumber, green onions, and carrot. Cover, and refrigerate at least 5 minutes.
tip: To complete your meal, consider eating with a 1/4 plate of rice and 1/4 plate of meat dish

name: Korean Soybean Sprouts
instruction:
Step 1: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the bean sprouts, and cook uncovered until tender yet still crisp, about 15 seconds.

Step 2: Drain in a colander, then immediately immerse in ice water for several minutes until cold to stop the cooking process. Once the bean sprouts are cold, drain well, and set aside. 

Step 3: Whisk soy sauce, sesame oil, chile powder, garlic, and sesame seeds together in a large bowl. Stir in bean sprouts and toss until well coated with the sauce.  

Step 4: Sprinkle with green onions and season with rice wine vinegar. Refrigerate before serving.
tip: To complete your meal, consider eating with a 1/4 plate of rice and 1/4 plate of meat dish

name: Korean Cucumber Kimchi
instruction:
Step 1: Cut off both ends of the cucumber. Divide the cucumber into 3 pieces then cross cut each piece length ways. You should end up with 4 to 5 cm (1.5 inch) length cucumber pieces. 

Step 2: Put the cucumber into a large bowl then scatter the coarse sea salt around on top. Gently mix them so that the cucumber gets pickled evenly. Set it aside for 20 minutes. 

Step 3: Gently brush off the salt from the cucumber then transfer the cucumber into a clean bowl. Pour in the kimchi sauce then mix them gently. (If using) Add the carrots and garlic chives then mix with the rest again. Transfer into a glass container and cover. 

Step 4: Keep it at room temperature for about 12 to 18 hours then move it to the fridge. Serve once chilled.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 1/4 plate amount of rice and 1/4 plate amount of meat dish

name: Korean Noodle Soup
instruction:
Step 1: Preheat a skillet/pan over medium low heat. Add some cooking oil and spread it around the pan. Add the beaten eggs and cook it like an egg omelette. When both sides are cooked, transfer it to a cutting board. Gently fold / roll up the egg omelette and thinly slice it. Set it aside. 

Step 2: Wipe the pan (from step 1) with kitchen paper and add a small amount of cooking oil. Add the zucchini and a pinch of salt and stir until it’s lightly cooked (1 to 2 mins). Set it aside. 

Step 3: Add a small amount of cooking oil. Add the carrots and a pinch of salt and stir until it’s lightly cooked (1 to 2 mins). Set it aside. 

Step 4: Add the 1/2 Tbsp soy sauce and 1/2 tsp salt into the soup stock to season. Boil it over medium – medium high heat until you are ready to serve the noodles. 

Step 5: Boil the somen noodles in rapidly boiling water until it cooks (about 2 to 3 mins). Drain the water and run under cold water briefly. 

Step 6: Serve the noodles into a soup bowl (you may want to use tongs if the noodles are still hot) and garnish with the egg, zucchini, and carrots. Add the boiled stock (from step 4). Serve warm immediately. Add the seasoning sauce as needed.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding vegetable topping such as cooked mushrooms, broccoli, and/or other vegetables

name: Korean Spinach side dish
instruction:
Step 1: Boil 8 to 10 cups of water in a large pot. 

Step 2: Blanch the spinach for 30 seconds to 1 minute with lid off, stirring with a wooden spoon.

Step 3: Strain the spinach and rinse in cold water a couple of times to remove any residual dirt. 

Step 4: Squeeze out excess water and cut a few times into bite size pieces. 

Step 5: Mix the spinach with garlic, green onion, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sesame seeds in a mixing bowl by hand. 

Step 6: Transfer to a bowl or plate. 

Step 7: Serve with rice.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 1/4 plate amount of rice and 1/4 plate amount of meat dish.

name: Korean Vegetable Pancake
instruction:
Step 1: Combine soy sauce, vinegar, hot pepper flakes (if using), and sesame seeds in a bowl and mix it well with a spoon. Transfer it to a small bowl. Seat aside. 

Step 2: Combine green onion, leek (if using), zucchini, green chili pepper (if using), onion, and sweet potato in a bowl. Add flour salt, and ¾ cup water. Mix it well with a wooden spoon.

Step 3: Heat up a large non-stick skillet over medium high heat. I use my 12 inch non-stick skillet to make one big pancake, but if your skillet is small, you can work in batches to make smaller ones. 

Step 4: Add about 2 tablespoons vegetable oil and swirl it around to coat the skillet evenly. Add the batter to the skillet and spread it out evenly. 

Step 5: Turn down the heat to medium and put the sliced mushroom on top. Gently press them in with a wooden spoon or spatula. 

Step 6: Cook for 4 to 5 minutes until the bottom turns crunchy light golden brown. Grab the handle of the skillet and twirl it around so the pancake moves and is cooked evenly underneath. 

Step 7: Turn or flip over the pancake. 

Step 8: Increase the heat to medium high and add 1 to 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil along the edges of the pancake. Lift up one edge with your spatula and tilt the skillet so the oil flows underneath the pancake. 

Step 9: Cook for 3 to 4 minutes until both sides turn light golden brown, occasionally pressing down with the spatula. 

Step 10: Flip it over one more time and cook another 2 minutes. Serve with dipping sauce.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 1/4 plate amount of meat dish

ingredients.name: Onion - Green
ingredients.measure: medium size, cut into 1 inch long

name: Cubed Radish Kimchi
instruction:
Step 1: Peel 4 pounds of Korean radish (or daikon). Rinse in cold water and pat dry. Cut it into ¾ to 1 inch cubes. Put into a large bowl. 

Step 2: Add 2 tbs salt, 2 tbs sugar, and mix well. 

Step 3: Set aside for 30 minutes. 

Step 4: Drain the juice from the radish into a small bowl. 

Step 5: Add 2 tbs minced garlic (about 5-6 cloves garlic), 1 ts minced ginger, 4 stalks of chopped green onions, ¼ cup fish sauce, 2/3 cup hot pepper flakes, and ⅓ cup of the juice from the radish. 

Step 6: Mix it up well until the seasonings coat the radish cubes evenly, and the radish looks juicy. 

Step 7: Put the kkakdugi into a glass jar and press down on the top of it to remove any air from between the radish cubes. 

Step 8: You can eat it right away, and then store it in the refrigerator. Or you can let it ferment by keeping it outside of the refrigerator for a few days. When it starts fermenting, little bubbles may appear on top of the kkakdugi and it’ll smell strong & sour. Then put it in the refrigerator.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 1/4 plate amount of rice and 1/4 plate amount of meat dish.

name: Korean Eggplant side dish
instruction:
Step 1: Prep your steamer by adding 2 cups of water to it. Set heat to medium-high for it to boil, it shoud take about 5 minutes. 

Step 2: Meanwhile, cut eggplants crosswise into 2½ inch pieces. Cut the thicker pieces in half lengthwise. 

Step 3: When the water starts boiling, put the eggplants on the steamer rack and cover. Steam for 5 minutes over medium high heat. 

Step 4: Remove from the heat. Take out the steamed eggplant and transfer to a cutting board. Let cool for 5 to 10 minutes until you can easily handle them. 

Step 5: Tear each piece into bite size pieces. 

Step 6: To make seasoning mixture, combine garlic, green onion, soy sauce, fish sauce, hot pepper flakes, sesame oil in a mixing bowl. Mix well. 

Step 7: Add the steamed eggplant to the bowl and mix well by hand or with the wooden spoon. Sprinkle with the crushed sesame seeds and serve with rice.
tip: To complete your meal, consider adding 1/4 plate amount of rice and 1/4 plate amount of meat dish.
